Author: dafunkystar
Subject: Clunk Clunk clunk
Body:
I'm going to echo much of the review by f001ish.

Used to be fast, now sluggish.

Author: Jeffreypaul21
Subject: Very disappointed
Body: I use Firefox on my MacBook and it’s great. The IOS app is a whole other story. It is hard to work, basically it’s just too cumbersome.  The bookmarks take too many steps to access and adding and moving between tabs is ridiculous.  Please clean it up as I am sure we’d all like to be consistent in what programs we use across all devices.

Author: Davide Lorenzon
Subject: Endlich moderne Oberfläche!
Body:
Dieses Update überzeugt auf ganzer Linie! 1Password Plugin läuft wieder, iPhone X Anpassung harmoniert perfekt mit der neuen nutzbaren Displayfläche und die Webseiten bauen sich sehr zügig auf. 

Mit Firefox Sync habe sofort alle Lesezeichen und Verläufe vom Mac auf iPhone und iPad.

Weiter so!
Translated Body: This update convinces on the whole line! 1Password plugin is running again, iPhone X customization blends perfectly with the new usable display surface and the websites build up very quickly. With Firefox Sync immediately have all bookmarks and gradients from the Mac to iPhone and iPad. Keep it up!

Subject: Actually a good browser,  but
Body:

Subject: 移动版无法登录
Body: 移动版登录信息输入后，总是报错“意外错误”。但邮箱每次都能收到确认登录信息。然后app上登不上去也没法同步书签那些。

Subject: Спасибо!
Body: Отличный браузер! Все замечательно, скорость, удобность. На ноутбуке тоже стоит последняя версия Firefox, и как следствие отличная синхронизация между ними. Благодарю вас. Единственное, здесь в настройках есть возможность поставить пароль и Touch ID, у меня не работает, но это не критично. Успехов Вам!
Translated Body: Great browser! Everything is wonderful, speed, convenience. The laptop also has the latest version of Firefox, and as a result, excellent synchronization between them. Thank you. The only thing here in the settings is the ability to put a password and a Touch ID, it does not work for me, but it's not critical. I wish you success!

Author: denisgodoy
Subject: Integração 1Password
Body: O navegador é bom e muito rápido, mas falta integração com o 1Password. A opção para abrir em outros aplicativos, como no Safari, que para mim é essencial.
Translated Body: The browser is good and very fast, but lack integration with 1Password. The option to open in other applications, such as Safari, which for me is essential.

Author: iTunesBreaksEveryComputer
Subject: User is not protected from Browser Attacks.
Body:
Vulnerable to Canvas Fingerprinting, WebRTC ip disclosure attacks, WebGL Fingerprinting, User Agent and Platform Fingerprinting, Time Zone HTTP Header and Font Fingerprinting, Referrer Leakage, and numerous other Javascript based browser attacks. 

Other browsers have active content blocking that protects against these attacks.

Subject: Gute Performance, bester Datenschutz
Body:
Auch vor der aktuellen großen Neuerung mit der Quantum Browser Engine und dem Photon Oberflächendesign war der Feuerfuchs mein liebster Browser. Gründe dafür gab es bisher schon viele (Datenschutz, sehr unterstützenswürdiges Projekt, hervorragende Einstellungen auf User-Bedarf usw.).

Nun ist der Firefox nochmal besser geworden: schneller und übersichtlicher. Zu schade, dass man den Safari bei iOS nicht ignorieren kann... beim Tipp auf Links in E-Mails öffnet sich stets der Apple Browser; um FFX zu nutzen muss man Umwege gehen, z.B. indem man Links zunächst kopiert und dann in Firefox einfügt.

Das hat natürlich seine Gründe, denn Safari sammelt wie Chrome auch fleißig Nutzerdaten für Werbezwecke und sonstwas. Dass man keinen eigenen „echten“ Standardbrowser wie Firefox in iOS festlegen kann ist für mich ein echter Nachteil von iOS.

I ❤️ my Firefox!
Translated Body: Even before the recent big change with the Quantum Browser Engine and the Photon surface design, the Firefox was my favorite browser. There were already many reasons for this (privacy, very supportive project, excellent settings for user needs, etc.). Now the Firefox has become even better: faster and clearer. Too bad that one can not ignore the Safari on iOS ... with the hint on links in emails always opens the Apple Browser; to use FFX you have to go detours, eg by first copying links and then inserting them in Firefox. Of course, this has its reasons, because Safari collects like Chrome also diligently user data for promotional purposes and whatever. The fact that you can not set your own "real" default browser like Firefox in iOS is for me a real disadvantage of iOS. I ❤️ my Firefox!

Subject: Desktop hui, Mobil na ja!
Body:
So sehr ich Firefox auf dem Desktop mag, auf mobilen Endgeräten bleibt der Frust. Alleine schon das Verhalten der Tabs bleibt mir völlig unverständlich. Zunächst mal werden diese wie auf dem Desktop immer im Hintergrund geöffnet. Leider sind sie aber auf dem iPad nicht sichtbar - erst wenn man wieder ein Stück nach oben scrollt oder den oberen Rand antippt, werden die Tabs eingeblendet. Bei beiden Varianten wird die Position im ersten Fenster verändert, so dass man später die zuletzt verlassene Stelle wieder suchen muss. Sorry, aber das ist leider Murks. Bitte gebt dem User die Möglichkeit, einen Tab (auch) im Vordergrund zu öffnen oder blendet sie zumindest (in welcher Form auch immer) oben oder unten ein.

Ergänzender Vorschlag:
Lasst den User in den Einstellungen entscheiden, ob er die Tabs permanent oben oder unten eingeblendet bekommt. 

Lesezeichen verwalten ist leider auch nicht möglich:
Ordner anlegen – nicht möglich!
Lesezeichen umbenennen – nicht möglich!
Lesezeichen umsortieren – nicht möglich!
Offenbar soll man damit zum Synchronisieren gezwungen werden.

Damit wird Firefox auf meinen mobilen Endgeräten nicht mein Standard–Browser.

First of all, they are always opened in the background, just like on the desktop. Unfortunately, they are not visible on the iPad - only when you scroll back a bit or tap the top of the tabs are faded in. In both variants, the position in the first window is changed, so that later you have to search for the last vacancy. Sorry, but unfortunately that's botch. Please give the user the opportunity to open a tab (also) in the foreground or at least show them (in whatever form) at the top or bottom. Supplementary suggestion: Let the user decide in the settings whether he always gets the tabs at the top or bottom. Unfortunately, managing bookmarks is also not possible: create folder - not possible! Rename bookmarks - not possible! Sort bookmarks - not possible! Apparently one should be forced to synchronize with it. This will not make Firefox my default browser on my mobile devices.

Ordner anlegen – nicht möglich!
Lesezeichen umbenennen – nicht möglich!

Subject: Grossartig, mit viel Potenzial
Body:

Grosses ungenutztes Potenzial steckt im konsequenten Ausbau zu noch mehr Privatsphäre analog der Desktop Version durch 
- Erlauben von eigenen Firefox Sync Servern
- ausweiten der Sync Funktionalität auf das komplette System (Adressbuch, Kalender, Bilder,...)
- Einführen von Add-Ons wie AdBlockern
- Bessere Systemintegration, z.B. Firefox wird zum systemweiten Standard Browser (möglicherweise wettbewerbsrechtliche Klage nötig analog Microsoft Windows & Internet Explorer....)
Translated Subject: Great, with a lot of potential
Translated Body: Great browser in terms of speed, features (night mode, hide graphics) and privacy (Firefox Sync, private browsing). Large untapped potential is in the consistent expansion to even more privacy analogous to the desktop version - Allowing own Firefox Sync servers - Extend the sync functionality to the entire system (address book, calendar, pictures, ...) - Introducing add-ons such AdBlockern - Better system integration, eg Firefox becomes the system-wide standard browser (possibly competition lawsuit similar to Microsoft Windows & Internet Explorer ....)

Author: Irritated1960
Subject: Good brower marred by PATHETIC Bookmark management
Body:
Got the new remixed version and I’m very satisfied with the stability, performance and versatility.  It’s faster than any other browser I’ve tried (Safari / Chrome / Dolphin), far more stable that my previous fave (Dolphin) and allows me the choice between the sometimes odious mobile version of a site and the original.

Huge Kudos for all that.

Two Nits:

1). I use this browser across platforms (Linux / Windows / IOS) and that aspect is magnificent.  I absolutely Hate the requirement to manage bookmarks Only via the desktop if I want to either have folder support or reorder them.  At least if you don’t want to have a Dolphin or Chrome-sryle bookmark management interface built into the browser, put it in the Sync web interface.  C’mon Mozilla, this is 2017.

2). Give this browser the ability to be the default browser on IOS devices a la Safari.

Please remedy at least the first nit.

Four stars.

Author: julberlin
Subject: Unlogisch!
Body:
Ich verstehe nicht, dass eine App wie Firefox anbietet, eine Startseite einzurichten – und dann bei Aufruf der App jedes Mal statt der festgelegten Startseite die bei der letzten Nutzung zuletzt genutzte Website auftaucht. 
Ich finde nirgendwo eine Erklärung dafür, aber auch keine Lösung.  
Die so genannte community antwortet nicht. In den FAQ findet sich nichts, was das erklärt. 
Ich finde es massiv lästig, wenn man oft etwas im Netz nach schauen will, jedes Mal zusätzliche schritte gehen zu müssen, um auf die gewünschte Startseite zu kommen 
Deshalb lösche ich Firefox OS wieder. Es gibt ja ganz gute Alternativen... Schade, ich würde Forefox durchaus gerne auch auf dem iPhone nutzen, denn ich bin es vom  Rechner her gewöhnt, und dort klappt es ziemlich gut. Dort kann man aber auch eine Startseite bestimmen, die dann wirklich als erstes erscheint wenn man das Programm öffnet. 
Da es keinen Support gibt, den man etwas fragen kann, die FAQs keine Lösung bieten und die community hier nicht weiterhilft, gebe ich es auf. Tschüss Firefox OS!
Translated Body: I do not understand that an app like Firefox offers to set up a home page - and then every time you visit the app instead of the specified home page the last used last time the website. I find nowhere an explanation for it, but also no solution. The so-called community does not answer. There is nothing in the FAQ that explains that. I find it massively annoying, if you often want to look something up on the net, every time you have to take additional steps to get to the desired home page. So I delete Firefox OS again. There are quite good alternatives ... Too bad, I would like to use Forefox also on the iPhone, because I'm used to it from the computer, and there it works pretty well. There you can also define a start page, which then really appears first when you open the program. Since there is no support that you can ask, FAQs do not provide a solution and the community does not help here, I give it up. Bye Firefox OS!

Author: 忆守顾
Subject: Firefox与Firefox Focus差别
Body:
先说一句，浏览器本身盈利难，可是也需要走心。

它的优点只有干净简洁。

而传统的浏览器，不错该有的都有了。可是新建页面广告特别多。还有就是广告拦截能力差，应该说差呢还是说会在网页中加广告。敢不敢集成Adblock Plus或uBLock Origin？？

它的优点只是功能较为健全（可是连安卓版的插件都没有），推送网页有时还有一分多钟的延时
Translated Body: First to say, the browser itself profit difficult, but also need to worry. Firefox browser version has its advantages and disadvantages, first focus. Its interface is clean and concise, lacking in functionality. Can not push the page to the PC side does not say, visit the webpage collection will not work, quit the browser can not remember, did not close the page before exiting. Its advantages are clean and concise. The traditional browser, it is true that some have it. However, many new page ads in particular. There is a poor interception of advertising, it should be worse or it will add ads on the page. Dare to integrate Adblock Plus or uBLock Origin? ? Its merit is more functional (but not even the Android plug-ins), push pages sometimes have more than a minute delay

Subject: Good update but...
Body:

There still needs to be a way to edit bookmarks and create folders to them... so that this iOS app is as useful as the desktop version. Also needs to add a way to use Find in PDFs. 

Issue (as of Nov 11 2017): Sometimes images get messed up when scrolling in night mode.

I realize iOS has restrictions so addons might not be allowed by Apple in Firefox; although, those would be really cool too. I hope the developers will take note of this review and I appreciate the open-source and transparent philosophy Firefox has supported over the years.

Translated Body: First to say, the browser itself profit difficult, but also need to worry. Firefox browser version has its advantages and disadvantages, first focus. Its interface is clean and concise, lacking in functionality. Can not push the page to the PC side does not say, visit the webpage collection will not work, quit the browser can not remember, did not close the page before exiting. Its advantages are clean and concise. The traditional browser, it is true that some have it. However, many new page ads in particular. Like most browsers in the market, the home page loads a bunch of unwanted news, especially if it is occasionally advertised. Its advantage is only more functional (even the Android version of the plug-ins are not), push the web sometimes have more than a minute delay

Subject: Version 10
Body:
Als langwieriger Firefox Nutzer kann ich auch nun wieder sagen: jedes Mal wenn man sich gerade an das neue Design gewöhnt hat wird es von euch wieder umgeworfen. Ich weiß OpenSource lebt davon das viele ihre Ideen einbringen können. Aber es gibt einen Grund dafür das große Unternehmen ihre GUI nicht alle Nase lang ändern. Und das ist der das man es nicht allen recht machen kann. Den auch wenn nicht jeder euer neues Design so unnötig findet wie ich so haben wir doch alle etwas gemeinsam: der Mensch ist ein Gewohnheitstier.
Ja das neue Design sieht gut aus aber an neuen Funktionen mangelt es. Alles in allem sorgt Version 10 nur dafür das ich mich mal wieder umgewöhnen muss ohne dafür viel Neues zubekommen. Firefox sollte darüber nachdenken ob es klug ist seine GUI weiter aussehen zu lassen wie „Wibbly Wobbly Timey Wimey“ oder ob ihr eurer Software mal Wiedererkennungswert mit einem festen Gesicht geben wollt.
Translated Body: As a lengthy Firefox user, I can now say again: every time you get used to the new design, it is overturned by you again. I know Open Source lives from the fact that many can bring their ideas. But there is a reason that big companies are not changing their GUI every now and then. And that's the one that can not please everyone. Even if not everyone finds your new design as unnecessary as I do, we all have something in common: man is a creature of habit. Yes, the new design looks good, but it lacks new features. All in all, version 10 only makes sure that I have to get used to it without getting a lot of new stuff. Firefox should think about whether it's wise to make their GUI look like "Wibbly Wobbly Timey Wimey" or if you want to give your software a recognizable look with a solid face.

Body:

The browser is easy to use, it loads pages quickly, and it’s (admittedly limited) settings options are simple and straight-forward. 

However there are a few settings that could be changed to improve the user experience:

1. Allow users to make desktop mode the default setting.

2. Allow users to set a default start-up page instead of opening all the tabs that were left open during the previous session.

3. Allow users to change the order of sites on the bookmarks and top sites pages.

I really like the new photon interface. In short, a success. The only small point I have to blame is that to open a tab we have to go to the list of tabs and press "+", it was a little faster on the old version with the quick menu in the middle of the bottom interface bar.

Subject: Mozilla, please don’t go “Chrome” on us!
Body:

I have been a devoted user of the Mozilla browser for 20+ years because it puts the relevant controls at my fingertips. This “minimalist” look gets away from Mozilla’s browser purpose with each update, on all platforms (PC, Android, & here for IOS). In particular with v10, the translucent appearance of the Settings menu is difficult. I am also not a fan of the Tabs being at the very top, I prefer them just above the page for quick reference to the Page’s Title, especially helpful to me when doing research on multiple sites - allowing quicker back & forth switching,

Can you consider switches for the Translucency and the Tab Row positioning? I would be very grateful. I do like the Images off & Night Modes choices - and the Sync & Pocket functions are monumental and make my (need for info) life so much easier! 😀

Thank you.

Subject: Good Safari alterna
Body: Possibly the best alternative to Safari on iOS. Not without it's faults though. I've never liked Top Sites, preferring to store my own sites. Although you can pin sites here, you cannot rearrange the order which is annoying. Once you navigate away from Top Sites, Bookmarks etc. there's no simple way to access these unless you open a new tab. A button on the menu bar would solve this. I also like the Safari approach that uses a drop down menu when you click on the search/address bar. I do welcome the tracker blocker but wish we could have an ad blocker too as ads eat into mobile data and take up too much room on smaller screens. Also could do with a 'do not track' request and the option to block 3rd party cookies, which I do on Firefox desktop. I would also like an easier way to delete private data as having to go through several menus before I close the browser is very tedious and irritating - it's a shame mobile devices loose the handy keyboard shortcuts desktop browsers have. Perhaps Firefox iOS could delete private data when you close the browser like the desktop browser does. I'll stick with Safari and keep Firefox to track it's progress and use for the occasional site that doesn't work properly in Safari.

Author: Isaac Gray
Subject: Needs UI tweaking and Adblocking integration
Body:
Dear Mozilla,

This is a product with tons of opportunities. The custom search engine script is amazing, and finally allows me to use a custom search query for a trustworthy engine (StartPage). This finally pulls me away from the control of Google. However, some tweaks would make it a better product on iPad and iPhone:

1) Add Adblocking ability from Firefox Focus. I realize that it is no small feat as Apple does not allow Firefox iOS to use the apple scripts for Adblocking, but adopting the block lists to the fully fledged app would be a gift to all.

Update: 9/22/2017. Thank you for adding tracking protection, and at different levels! This is a huge improvement for user privacy and I commend Mozilla for continuing to fight the good fight against tracking.

2) Make bookmarks editable (renamable) and their order organizable. Currently you can only delete or open them in a new tab as options. It's not a mature feature set.

3) Move the new tab button on the tab viewing page from the bottom left to the bottom right. This keeps you from having to travel the diagonal from the tab button (upper right) to the opposite (bottom left) corner, switching hands. Useful on iPad, VERY USEFUL for iPhone use, which is often one handed.

Update 11/9/2017
The good guys at Mozilla DID IT! The new “photon” layout is easier than ever to use! Thanks for listening to users and making the UI more accessible!

4) the pin to top sites feature only allows one link to the domain of choice. If I want to have a link to my Amazon Orders, that will take over the general Amazon.com link. Make this more like the safari Favorites tab! There's no need to reinvent the wheel. Customization, privacy, and autonomy should be the hallmark of Firefox. Not some gimmicky, clunky suggested websites. What if I visit an illicit website and don't want to worry about it poppin up in a new tab?? I get it, use private browsing mode, but the suggested websites panel should be an option you can disable.

Lots of potential, but the app needs some streamlining and more options for the user. Apple locks us down, but Mozilla can potentially set us free.

Author: 19las97
Subject: It’s good
Body:
I’ve been using Firefox as my main browser for many many years. It’s the only browser I feel I can really/fully trust.
The iOS app is good and it’s great it finally includes the built-in Tracking Protection feature. If you are a Firefox user, the “Send tabs” feature is really useful + you can use it share tabs or websites (between your devices that have Firefox installed) from other apps too (e.g. Safari).

Although the app is good, I feel like there is still room for improvement or development

Author: Oo0Bailey0oO
Subject: Too buggy, too many regressions, too slow to turn-around
Body:
Password manager support took way too long to implement into Firefox iOS in the first place, only to disappear about five releases ago due to a what I imagine was a serious oversight on a regression.

I cannot believe that it's five releases later and this bug still hasn't been fixed. I've tried to work-around this deficiency but it's so cumbersome to copy and paste like it's five years ago again that I've started to route to Safari instead.

Combine this with about six other persistently annoying bugs (last tab disappearing, keyboard interface disappearing when typing URL, others) and I'm not sure how much longer I can support my Internet activist beliefs over efficiency and pragmatism.

Author: grimoire_games
Subject: “Tracking protection” now default
Body: It seems Firefox bends further to the will of Google. This is fine and everything, but for those who actually value privacy, it’s yet another knock. Of course you shouldn’t be using phone apps at all for privacy, they’re locked up. In my desktop I can go into firefox config and disable leaks where they occur, so they’re still my goto browser for most things.  Tracking protecting neither protects you from trackers or help in any way.  It: Sends a signal do a site “Please don’t track me.” The site or any of the 3rd party scripts (which don’t necessarily receive the request) either care or they don’t, meanwhile, they can gain data about your system and connection. In addition to thatFirefox >> Google is gathering statistics about this useless event, so it’s essentially a tracking tool masquerading as a internet privacy tool. Turn it off.  I’m going to be using another browser
